vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[flask](https://pypi.org/project/Flask/) is a lightweight WSGI web application framework.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Input Validation. It did not detect the encoding of incoming JSON data as one of the supported UTF encodings, and allowed arbitrary encodings from the request.

## Remediation
Upgrade `flask` to version 0.12.3 or higher.

## References
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/pallets/flask/pull/2691)
- [GitHub Release Tag](https://github.com/pallets/flask/releases/tag/0.12.3)
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.name: flask

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

[Flask](https://pypi.org/project/Flask/) is a lightweight WSGI web application framework


Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS).
The package allows for unsafe encoded JSON data to be decoded.

## Remediation

Upgrade `Flask` to version 1.0 or higher.


## References

- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/pallets/flask/pull/2691)

- [Release Notes](https://www.palletsprojects.com/blog/flask-1-0-released/)
vulnerabilities.title: Denial of Service (DoS)
vulnerabilities.name: flask

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

[jinja2](https://pypi.org/project/Jinja2/) is a template engine written in pure Python. It provides a Django inspired non-XML syntax but supports inline expressions and an optional sandboxed environment.


Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Sandbox Escape
via the `str.format_map`.

## Remediation

Upgrade `jinja2` to version 2.10.1 or higher.


## References

- [Release Notes](https://palletsprojects.com/blog/jinja-2-10-1-released)
vulnerabilities.title: Sandbox Escape
vulnerabilities.name: Jinja2

vulnerabilities.description:

vulnerabilities.title: Sandbox Escape
vulnerabilities.name: Jinja2

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[Requests](https://pypi.org/project/requests/) is a  _Non-GMO_ HTTP library for Python

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Information Exposure.
Upon receiving a same-hostname https-to-http redirect, it sends the HTTP Authorization header to an http URI. This makes it easier for remote attackers to discover credentials by sniffing the network.

## Remediation
Upgrade `request` to version 2.20 or higher.

## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/requests/requests/commit/c45d7c49ea75133e52ab22a8e9e13173938e36ff)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/requests/requests/issues/4716)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/requests/requests/pull/4718)
vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.name: requests

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[Requests](https://pypi.org/project/requests/) is a  _Non-GMO_ HTTP library for Python

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Information Exposure.
Upon receiving a same-hostname https-to-http redirect, it sends the HTTP Authorization header to an http URI. This makes it easier for remote attackers to discover credentials by sniffing the network.

## Remediation
Upgrade `request` to version 2.20 or higher.

## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/requests/requests/commit/c45d7c49ea75133e52ab22a8e9e13173938e36ff)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/requests/requests/issues/4716)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/requests/requests/pull/4718)
vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.name: requests

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

[urllib3](https://pypi.org/project/urllib3/) is an HTTP library with thread-safe connection pooling, file post, and more.


Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to CRLF injection.
Attacker who has the control of the requesting address parameter, could  manipulate an HTTP header and attack an internal service.

## PoC
by `ragdoll` and `Alvin Chang`
```
import urllib3

pool_manager = urllib3.PoolManager()

host = "localhost:7777?a=1 HTTP/1.1\r\nX-injected: header\r\nTEST: 123"
url = "http://" + host + ":8080/test/?test=a"

try:
    info = pool_manager.request('GET', url).info()
    print(info)
except Exception:
    pass

# nc -l localhost 7777
GET /?a=1 HTTP/1.1
X-injected: header
TEST: 123:8080/test/?test=a HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:7777
Accept-Encoding: identity
```
The nc server will display the HTTP request with a manipulated header content: `X-injected:header`, indicating a successful injection of the HTTP header.

## Remediation

Upgrade `urllib3` to version 1.24.3 or higher.


## References

- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/urllib3/urllib3/commit/5d523706c7b03f947dc50a7e783758a2bfff0532)

- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/urllib3/urllib3/issues/1553)

- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/urllib3/urllib3/pull/1487)

- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/urllib3/urllib3/pull/1531)

- [Python Bug Report](https://bugs.python.org/issue36276)
vulnerabilities.title: CRLF injection
vulnerabilities.name: urllib3

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

[urllib3](https://pypi.org/project/urllib3/) is an HTTP library with thread-safe connection pooling, file post, and more.


Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Certificate Validation.
It mishandles certain cases where the desired set of CA certificates is different from the OS store of CA certificates. This can result in SSL connections succeeding in situations where it should have failed.

## Remediation

Upgrade `urllib3` to version 1.24.2 or higher.


## References

- [GitHub Comparison](https://github.com/urllib3/urllib3/compare/a6ec68a...1efadf4)
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Certificate Validation
vulnerabilities.name: urllib3

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
 
[urllib3](https://pypi.org/project/urllib3/) is a HTTP library with thread-safe connection pooling, file post, and more.


Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Authentication Bypass.
It did remove the Authorization HTTP header when following a cross-origin redirect. This can allow for credentials in the Authorization header to be exposed to unintended hosts or transmitted in cleartext.

## Remediation

Upgrade urllib3 to version 1.23 or higher.


## References

- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/urllib3/urllib3/issues/1316)

- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/urllib3/urllib3/pull/1346)

- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1649153)
vulnerabilities.title: Authentication Bypass
vulnerabilities.name: urllib3

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

[Werkzeug](https://werkzeug.palletsprojects.com/) is a WSGI web application library.


Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Insufficient Randomness
when used with Docker, it has insufficient debugger PIN randomness because Docker containers share the same machine id.

## Remediation

Upgrade `Werkzeug` to version 0.15.3 or higher.


## References

- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/pallets/werkzeug/commit/00bc43b1672e662e5e3b8cecd79e67fc968fa246)

- [Release Notes](https://palletsprojects.com/blog/werkzeug-0-15-3-released/)

- [Vulnerable Code](https://github.com/pallets/werkzeug/blob/7fef41b120327d3912fbe12fb64f1951496fcf3e/src/werkzeug/debug/__init__.py#L168)
vulnerabilities.title: Insufficient Randomness
vulnerabilities.name: Werkzeug

[Requests](https://pypi.org/project/requests/) is a  _Non-GMO_ HTTP library for Python

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Information Exposure.
Upon receiving a same-hostname https-to-http redirect, it sends the HTTP Authorization header to an http URI. This makes it easier for remote attackers to discover credentials by sniffing the network.

Upgrade `request` to version 2.20 or higher.
